text: <@UDHT6N5SM> Yes Child themes can have the same named module exist at the same path and be a completely different version of the module. The child theme can also have modules that the Parent theme does not.
<@UQWGKUEN7> thanks! Just to clarify, do child themes automatically receive all of the parents theme modules? Can they then be deleted without effecting the parent?

So the child theme actually starts blank - in the design manager at least. The only thing there is a copy of fields.json and theme.json. And it pulls everything form the parent. If you include a file at the same path in the child that exists in the parent then HS will konw to use the child version of it instead of the parent version of it
Interesting. I guess “make available” should work then if duplicated
